text: St. Nicholas Magazine was a 19th-century American monthly children's magazine. It was published between 1873 and 1943 by Scribner's & Co. It was directed for 32 years by Mary Mapes Dodge. Writers published in the magazine include Louisa May Alcott, Frances Hodgson Burnett, and Rudyard Kipling. It folded in 1943.Silvey, Anita. Children's Books and Their Creators. Houghton, Mifflin, Harcourt, pp. 429-430. ==References== Category:19th-century American children's magazines Category:American monthly magazines
title: St. Nicholas Magazine
